Description: AWS CloudFormation Infinit.e Base template to be adjusted to support both API and DB nodes. This version installs the RPMs from JIRA.

NodeName.Description: MANDATORY: The name used to display the node in the EC2 instances list (eg <projectname>-<function>-node. It is recommended that this be given the same name as the stack.

ClusterName.Description: MANDATORY: The name of the cluster within the set of EC2 instances that the node should join

ReplicaSetIds.Description: MANDATORY: An Infinit.e DB consists of 1+ replica sets, over which writes are balanced. Each replica set consists of 1+ nodes, over which reads are balanced. The replica sets (new ones can be added any time, as well as new nodes to replica sets) should be named in ascending order: 1, 2, 3 etc. Each node can belong to multiple replica sets by specifying a comma separated list eg '1,3,5'. Note that normally each node will just belong to one replica set.
ReplicaSetIds.ConstraintDescription: Normally just a single integer, the id of the replica set. Can also be a comma separated list for replica set ids, to join the node to multiple replica sets.

AvailabilityZone.Description: MANDATORY: The availability zone in which to create the node (must be consistent with region from which stack is launched)

KeyName.Description: MANDATORY: Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instance (eg production, development, etc)

SecurityGroups.Description: MANDATORY: Infinit.e EC2 security group: eg production_db, production_api, default etc

ConfigFileS3Path.Description: MANDATORY: S3 of the file that controls the configuration of the node within the cluster

AwsAccessId.Description: MANDATORY: The AWS id (sometimes called access key) allowing access to S3

AwsAccessKey.Description: MANDATORY: The AWS key (sometimes called secret key) allowing access to S3

QuickInstall.Description: OPTIONAL: Set to '--fast' (default) for quick install, '--slow' to get latest Java/Jpackage/splunk.
QuickInstall.ConstraintDescription: Set to '--fast' (default) for quick install, '--slow' to get latest Java/Jpackage/splunk.

IsConfigSvr.Description: OPTIONAL: Set to 1 to run a config server on this node (1, 3, or 5 per cluster are required; they can run on their own machine or on any other DB node).
IsConfigSvr.ConstraintDescription: 0 (default) to disable the config server on this node, 1 to make it one of the 1/3/5 in the cluster.

IsStorageNode.Description: OPTIONAL: Set to 1 (default) to run a storage node (you can run both as a storage node or both storage node and config server), 0 to run as a standalone config server. Note that ReplicaSetIds must be specified if this is set to 1.
IsStorageNode.ConstraintDescription: Set to 1 (default) to run a storage node, 0 to run as a standalone config server.

InstanceType.Description: OPTIONAL: Infinit.e EC2 instance type: m1.xlarge recommended for operational deployments, m1.large for dev/test deployments or standalone config servers
InstanceType.ConstraintDescription: m1.large (dev/test deployments, standalone config servers), m1.xlarge (operational deployments).

Fn::Join: for i in `seq 1 4`; do echo '' >> s3; done;
echo n >> s3; echo y >> s3; echo n >> s3;
